intro: Lychnophora crispa, commonly known as the crinkled lychnophora, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a textured appearance. Its small, yellow to orange flowers are arranged in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. Lychnophora crispa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
